title: Easily Format an SD Card on a Mac Desktop or MacBook

steps.title: Insert the SD card into the SD card slot on your Mac.
steps.content: Insert the SD card into the SD card slot on your Mac. This will allow you to format an SD card using Apple's built-in Disk Utility app. Some Macs have built-in SD card slots, which support the following types of SD media: MMC, Default Speed, High Speed, UHS-I, UHS-II. [1] X Research source If your Mac doesn't have an SD card slot, you can purchase a USB-C SD card reader that connects to your Mac. You'll find an SD slot on the following Macs: Mac Studio (2022) MacBook Pro (2021 and later, and 2011-2015) Mac Mini (2011-2014) MacBook Air (13-inch models from 2013-2017) iMac (27" and 21.5" models from 2010 and later) If your SD card is too small to fit into the SD slot, such as a MiniSD or MicroSD card , you can insert it into an SD adapter to make it fit into the slot. When shopping for an adapter, look for "MiniSD to SD adapter" or "MicroSD to SD adapter." Reformatting your SD card will completely erase its contents. Copy its files to a new location on your computer if they need to be saved.

steps.title: Open Disk Utility on your Mac.
steps.content: Open Disk Utility on your Mac. This app allows you to erase and reformat your SD card. To open the app: [2] X Research source Press Command + Spacebar at the same time and type disk utility . Click Disk Utility to open it on your Mac.

steps.title: Select your SD card in the left menu.
steps.content: Select your SD card in the left menu. This will open a new page with options. If you don't see a list of disks, go to View > Show All Devices to open the list.

steps.title: Click the Erase button.
steps.content: Click the Erase button. It is a small drive icon with an X on it at the top of the app. A pop-up menu will appear for erasing the SD card. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Type a name for your SD card.
steps.content: Type a name for your SD card. This is how your SD card will appear when you insert it into a computer, phone, or tablet. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select a format for your SD card.
steps.content: Select a format for your SD card. Click the drop-down menu next to "Format" to choose one of the following format options: [5] X Research source If you plan to use the SD card in various devices, including digital cameras, Macs, PCs, and/or phones, choose exFAT as the format. This ensures that your SD card is compatible with the widest variety of devices, including your Mac. If you are only going to use the SD card on computers running macOS, you can choose MacOS Extended (Journaled) .

steps.title: Click Erase to format your SD card.
steps.content: Click Erase to format your SD card. This erases and formats your memory card. Once the format is complete, click Done to continue. You can now eject the card from your Mac by clicking the eject button next to its name in the Disk Utility app.
